main event: A geophysicist observed a cylindrical, bluish-white object while driving near Calhoun, Louisiana on October 13, 1958.
interesting points: The object was the size of a match head and very brilliant, emitting a trace of green light when extinguished., Small sparks were projected in the main trail of light., The sighting lasted between 20 to 30 seconds., The object moved from north to south with a downward trajectory., Weather conditions were clear with no reported air traffic in the area at the time of the sighting.
